III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4152 Initial documentation.
At the time of admission, all of the following shall be in the
resident's case record:
(a) Name, address, birth date, sex, gender, race, height,
weight, hair color, eye color, identifying marks, religious
preference, and school status.
One of two closed case files reviewed was found to have omitted the youth’s
religious preference and identifying marks on the initial documentation.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
does not service youth in foster care.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is not contracted with MDHHS for shelter care of
youth in foster care.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The facility is advised to ensure that they request annual central registry clearances
well enough in advance to allow for delays in processing.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
No consultation was requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
4

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. There were no repeated violations, and
there was documentation in the files of the use of the new form created to address
the previous noncompliance, therefore, it appears the facility CAP was implemented
and is being followed. It appears that the facility is making attempts to comply with
licensing rules.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
